definition: "water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
dense/thick (fog, clouds etc)/to have a strong interest in/deep/fully saturated (color)
to concentrate (a liquid)/concentration/espresso coffee/abbr. for 意式濃縮咖啡|意式浓缩咖啡
concentration (percentage of dissolved material in a solution)/consistency/thickness/density/viscosity
thick and heavy in colors/to describe sth in colorful language with attention to detail (idiom)
to apply makeup conspicuously (idiom)/dressed to the nines and wearing makeup

sentences.english: Avoid mini skirts, too much make up, and excessive jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 避免迷你裙，化太浓的妆和过多的首饰。

sentences.english: To some extent, a given concentration of H2SO4 were active to shed seed villus.
sentences.chinese: 一定浓度的浓H2SO4对花卉种子具有脱绒效果。

sentences.english: The smoke grew thicker and I could see flames all around.
sentences.chinese: 烟雾越来越浓，四处火舌冲天。

sentences.english: Blend egg with 2 tbsp of mungbean flour. Add in chicken and mix well.
sentences.chinese: 鸡蛋加生粉2汤匙拌匀成浓糊状，加入鸡块拦匀。

sentences.english: This aircraft works by jet [ propulsion ].
sentences.chinese: 航空部对喷射推进的兴趣渐浓。

sentences.english: Love begins with a smile, grows with a kiss and ends witha tear.
sentences.chinese: 爱其于微笑，随着亲吻而愈浓，并逝于眼泪。

sentences.english: Here, cooling with wind, shadowing with greenery.
sentences.chinese: 这里，清风送爽，绿意更浓。

sentences.english: The stronger the taste of the garlic, the more sulfur content it has and therefore the greater are the medicinal benefits.
sentences.chinese: 大蒜的味越浓，含硫量越多，医疗效果越大。

sentences.english: This sweet, thick drink is made of ice cream and milk.
sentences.chinese: 这种又甜又浓的饮料是由冰淇林和牛奶制成的。

sentences.english: He has a stern face and he simply nods before shooting off into the gathering darkness.
sentences.chinese: 他一脸严肃地点点头，开车驶入越来越浓的夜色中。

sentences.english: The tea has orchid aroma and tastes mellow and thick.
sentences.chinese: 冲泡后，有天然的兰花香，滋味纯浓。

sentences.english: Use the FRESH tomatoes and make sure the soup is THICK.
sentences.chinese: 主味西红柿，一定要新鲜，并烧至汤浓。

sentences.english: If they had been red through, how luxurious they would have been in the sun shine!
sentences.chinese: 要是红透了，太阳一照，那颜色该有多浓。

sentences.english: Dew had fallen heavily since the wind had dropped.
Youthful hue, good concentration, thin pink rim.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的色调，色浓，边缘呈粉红色。

sentences.english: In parts of Saint Emilion the gravel lies on limestone base.
sentences.chinese: 部分圣爱米浓产区砂砾层都平铺于石灰石土层上。

definition: insipid/diluted/weak/mild/light in color/tasteless/indifferent/(variant of 氮[dan4]) nitrogen
dense/thick (fog, clouds etc)/to have a strong interest in/deep/fully saturated (color)
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
alcohol/wine with high alcohol content/rich/pure/good wine/sterols
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
variant of 彌漫|弥漫[mi2 man4]
